title: Ethereum’s (ETH) Price Rally Set To Persist, On-Chain Data Shows - NewsBTC
summary: Ethereum (ETH) is experiencing a bullish momentum, with its price rallying and breaking significant resistance levels. On-chain data shows that over 200,000 addresses have purchased over 18 million ETH at the $2,100-$2,150 level, making it a crucial resistance area for the cryptocurrency. However, if Ethereum can maintain its momentum and surpass this resistance level, it is well-positioned to reach new yearly highs and consolidate above the $2,000 mark. A fractal mirrors a bullish pattern for ETH, and the upcoming Shappella upgrade could further drive its price upwards. Despite the recent surge, Ethereum has also seen a high rate of liquidations, with approximately $30 million worth occurring within 24 hours at the $1,880 level. It is now crucial for ETH to maintain its current level as a support and consolidate above the $1,900 mark to continue its upward trend. As of writing, Ethereum is trading at $1,867,

title: PancakeSwap V3 Launches On BNB Chain and Ethereum - The Defiant - DeFi News
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

PancakeSwap, a leading DEX on BNB Chain and Ethereum, has launched V3 with improved capital efficiency and an overhauled fee structure. The new version features custom price ranges for liquidity providers, who can earn higher fees with improved capital efficiency. The AMM's fee structure has been completely overhauled, with V3 offering fee tiers of 0.01%, 0.05%, 0.25%, and 1%. PancakeSwap V3 has also introduced a new feature called Position Manager, which allows liquidity providers to deposit liquidity with a single click and enable automated management strategies. Additionally, a VIP trading rewards program is in the works, which will grant loyal users exclusive perks based on their trading activity.

title: Satellite orbiting Earth participates in the Ethereum KZG ceremony - Cointelegraph
summary: A satellite orbiting Earth, Cryptosat, has contributed entropy to the Ethereum KZG ceremony, a cryptographic foundation for Ethereum scaling. The satellite, Crypto2, generated entropy through its Verifiable Random Beacon service, which was signed by the satellite itself and can be verified using the public key of Crypto2. This contribution is part of the Ethereum Foundation's request for randomness to strengthen security. Cryptosat is one of thousands of participants in the KZG ceremony, and its contribution will be viewable in real-time. The Ethereum Shanghai upgrade, for which the entropy was generated, is scheduled for April 12.

title: Ethereum ERC-4337 'bundlers' — How hard is joining the network? - Cointelegraph
summary: Ethereum has recently added a new layer, ERC-4337, which enables the creation of "smart accounts" or "account abstraction." This new layer allows for more complex transactions to be completed in a single step, and introduces a new way for nodes to earn fees. However, becoming a successful "Bundler," a node that organizes and submits user operations to the network, may be challenging due to the competitive nature of the market. The introduction of ERC-4337 has also led to an ongoing debate about the potential impact on Ethereum gas fees. While it is still too early to tell, current expectations suggest that gas fees may not change significantly.

title: Ethereum Archive Node service shuts down, saying it 'succeeded' - Cointelegraph
summary: ArchiveNode.io, a free Ethereum mainnet archive node service, will shut down on April 4, citing success and the availability of alternative solutions. The service provided historical blockchain data to developers, students, and researchers, but is no longer necessary due to the existence of robust remote procedure call (RPC) providers offering access to archive data. The project was initiated by "DeFi Dude" and received an initial grant of $10,000 from the Ethereum Foundation. While ArchiveNodes are not required for block validation, they require greater storage capacity and were previously the only option for accessing archive data, with Infura charging $250 monthly. The project was never intended to make money or profit, and the shutdown is seen as a success rather than a sad ending.

title: A Guide to Base, Coinbase's Ethereum L2 - Unchained - Unchained
summary: Coinbase is launching Base, a layer-2 (L2) network built atop Ethereum to solve the problem of slow and expensive transactions on the Ethereum network. Base is based on Optimism's open-source software and will use optimistic rollups, which assume that transactions are valid but provide a mechanism for users to prove fraud. Unlike Optimism, Base will be built in-house by Coinbase and will not issue its own token. Base promises lower transaction costs and access to Coinbase's products, users, and tools for developers. The testnet launched in February 2023, with a mainnet launch planned for the future.

title: Ethereum (ETH) vs. Bitcoin (BTC) Chart Indication Might Mean This for Altcoins: Miles Deutscher - U.Today
summary: Ethereum (ETH) is showing strength against Bitcoin (BTC) on their daily chart, with a potential breakout and support/resistance flip. This could be a sign of capital rotation into ETH ahead of the Shanghai upgrade, which will allow for staked ETH withdrawals. The last time ETH traded at such oversold levels to BTC produced fresh highs on the ETH/BTC chart, raising the possibility of a sustained rebound in the coming weeks. Sustained strength in ETH could bode well for altcoins, but ETH faces a barrier coinciding with moving averages on its BTC chart. On the upside, ETH is breaking out according to on-chain data, with a critical resistance area between $2,100 and $2,150 where over 200K addresses purchased 18 million ETH.

title: Remember POGs? They're Back—in Ethereum NFT Form - Yahoo Finance
summary: POGs, a popular '90s playground toy, are making a comeback in the form of NFTs on the Ethereum blockchain. The POGs NFT collection will feature 3,800 unique digital collectibles, including POGs and slammers, with artwork from popular NFT projects like Bored Ape Yacht Club and Moonbirds. The NFTs can be used within upcoming Ethereum-based video games, and the team plans to release physical packs of Web3-themed POGs in May. The founder of POGs NFTs, Kyler Frisbee, aims to create a play-for-keeps physical game that uses NFC chips within the POGs to transfer tokenized ownership, and plans to bring physical POGs back in a big way with the NFT expansion and celebrity partnerships.

title: CANDEY LLC: Ethereum "Update" Exposes Frozen Assets to Misappropriation, Despite Global Freezing Order, Warns ... - Yahoo Finance
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

An entrepreneur is fighting to recover $22 million in frozen assets after alleging that his former business partners misappropriated the funds. The case involves a crypto real estate fund, Tensigma, and the upcoming "Shanghai upgrade" to the Ethereum platform, which could potentially empower the partners to abscond with more funds. The entrepreneur, Arman Oyokenov, claims that his former partners, Julian Svirsky and Denis Donin, stole over $6 million in cryptocurrency and hidden it. The court has granted a worldwide freezing order prohibiting the pair from dealing with the assets, but they have appealed the order. The case raises concerns about the ability of regulators and the courts to combat fraud and money-laundering on crypto networks.

title: Free POAP? Not for Commercial Users of the Ethereum Attendance NFTs - Decrypt
summary: POAP, a leading NFT attendance badge service, will soon start charging commercial clients for access to its services, ending its free policy for commercial use. The company aims to bring POAPs to a broader audience and ensure long-term sustainability. Personal use of POAPs will still be free, while commercial clients will be charged based on the number of POAPs issued, starting from $1 per POAP. Commercial users can opt for special pricing for an unspecified period. POAP has released guidelines to determine whether an event is personal or commercial, and the company hopes this move will encourage users to consider the best applications for its services and cement its staying power.

title: Rogue Ethereum Validator Slashed After $25 Million MEV Bot Attack - Unchained - Unchained
summary: A rogue validator on the Ethereum network was slashed after stealing $25 million from MEV "sandwich bots" in a single block. The validator front-ran the MEV bots by forcing a series of transactions and collecting a significant profit. Although the validator was penalized, some users saw the attack as a small price to pay compared to the profit earned. The attack highlighted vulnerabilities in the MEV system and developers are rolling out a patch to fix the relayer bug.

title: Remember POGs? They’re Back—in Ethereum NFT Form - Decrypt
summary: POGs, a 90s playground sensation, are making a comeback in the form of Ethereum NFTs. The POGs NFT founder, Kyler Frisbee, has partnered with Origin Protocol's Origin Story NFT platform to create a custom marketplace for the drop. 3,800 Ethereum NFTs will be released on April 6, featuring unique artwork for each. The NFTs can be used in upcoming Ethereum-based video games set to launch this summer. Some of the NFTs will feature artwork from popular NFT projects like Bored Ape Yacht Club and Moonbirds. The goal of POGs NFTs is to deliver digital collectibles that feed into video games and pair with the physical POGs experience. The company plans to bring physical POGs back in a big way with celebrity partners and the official global distribution of the NFTs.

title: Polygon zkEVM TVL Soars 250%, Aave Votes to Deploy on Network - DailyCoin
summary: Polygon zkEVM TVL has soared 250% in just a week, reaching $2.51 million. Despite being small compared to other rollups, Polygon zkEVM is gaining traction with blue chip DeFi protocol Aave voting to deploy on the network. However, the platform is still in beta and needs optimizations.

title: Ethereum Locked-in Beacon Contract Surpasses 18 Million - CryptoCoin.News
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum's Beacon contract has surpassed 18 million ETH locked, representing 15% of the total supply. New validators have been joining the network rapidly, with 67,500 new validators arriving since January 1. The number of validators has increased to 562,787 as of April 1. The Shanghai upgrade is expected to decrease the number of validators, but then increase again. Validators are currently rewarded with 5.2% APR, and someone who staked 32 ETH in December 2020 would have made a profit of around 3.5 times. However, there may be pressure to sell due to the withdrawal option being available, which could lead to a rapid price drop and liquidity crisis. The ETH price has risen 50% since the beginning of the year, with high volatility expected in the days before and after the Shanghai upgrade.

title: The Doge-ETH Bridge Is Live, What To Expect? - CoinGape
summary:
Sure! Here's a summary of the financial news in less than 256 tokens:

The Doge-ETH bridge is live, enabling users to stake, lend, and perform DeFi functions with their DOGE. This wrapped version of DOGE opens up new possibilities for DOGE holders, allowing them to participate in various DeFi applications.

title: Should You Buy This New Crypto With Explosive Upside Potential? - The Motley Fool
summary: Arbitrum, a new crypto token, has sparked hype and speculation after announcing a crypto airdrop of 1 billion tokens to users, developers, and investors. However, the token's price has fallen by 90% since its early price of over $11, as new token owners sold their holdings to lock in profits. Despite this, some bulls predict that the token could double in value by the end of April. The token's growth prospects are tied to the future of Ethereum, as it is a Layer 2 scaling solution for the blockchain. Arbitrum already has a significant share of the total value locked (TVL) on the blockchain, and developers are using it for new blockchain projects. However, the Layer 2 field is becoming more crowded, which could impact future market share projections. The token's early performance issues, including a sharp price drop on the first day of trading, have raised concerns. Some analysts suggest that the price of Arbitrum could reverse soon, while others recommend investing in Ethereum instead.

title: 73.3% of Q1 rug pulls happened on BNB Chain: Immunefi - Cointelegraph
summary: BNB Chain, a popular blockchain network, has seen a staggering 73.3% of all rug pulls (scams where developers raise funds and then disappear) in the first quarter of 2023, according to a report by Immunefi. This is the largest percentage of any crypto ecosystem. Ethereum and BNB Chain combined accounted for 68.8% of total losses from hacks and scams. Immunefi's tech lead, Adrian Hetman, attributes this to a culture of forking open-source code without a security-first approach, which attracts users looking to make quick money. Despite this, rug pulls and other frauds are a smaller problem than hacks or exploits, with hacks being the predominant cause of losses in Q1 2023.

title: Sharding, True USD Launches and More Custody Players: This Week in Crypto - CCN.com
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the financial news in less than 256 tokens:

This week in crypto, Citigroup announced it will offer crypto custody solutions to institutional investors through its Digital Asset Receipt (DAR) product. This will enable investors to invest in cryptocurrencies in a fully insured and regulated manner. Additionally, True USD, a stablecoin, launched, and sharding, a scaling solution, was also discussed as a potential solution to the scalability problem in the blockchain industry.

title: As PancakeSwap V3 goes live on BNB Chain and Ethereum, CAKE reacted by… - AMBCrypto News
summary: PancakeSwap V3, a new version of the decentralized exchange, has been launched on both BNB Chain and Ethereum. The new version offers lower fees, up to 25 times lower than the previous version, which could attract new users and increase revenue. However, the network value of PancakeSwap (CAKE) has not seen a positive impact yet, with a stagnant total value locked (TVL) and a declining price momentum. Despite this, CAKE's MVRV ratio has recovered slightly, and whales' interest in the token has increased. The launch of V3 could lead to a price hike in the near term, as indicated by market indicators such as MACD and CMF. However, the RSI is below 50, indicating that the token is still in a bearish phase.

title: ETH staking surges, could liquid staking derivatives see an upside - AMBCrypto News
summary: Ethereum staking surges ahead of Shanghai Upgrade, with 15% of ETH supply staked. Liquid Staking Derivatives (LSDs) see increased popularity, with Lido, Frax Finance, and Rocket Pool benefiting. Lido's TVL and revenue have surged, with other protocols also seeing growth in interest.

title: Masa announces soulbound ID tokens for Coinbase's Base Network - Cointelegraph
summary: Masa Finance is launching soulbound ID tokens on Coinbase's Base network, allowing users to link identifying and reputational characteristics to their wallet addresses. This will enable credit underwriting on the blockchain. Masa had previously released its Soulbound Token protocol for Ethereum and Celer. Coinbase is the largest centralized crypto exchange in North America and launched its Base Network testnet in February. The company is asking developers to create protocols for Base, including an on-chain reputation system. The announcement of Base Network's creation has contributed to bullish sentiment within the Ethereum community, with some users hoping it will lead to greater onboarding of Coinbase users to Ethereum.

title: Vitalik Proposes zk-EVM Integration For Ethereum $ETH - CryptoDaily
summary: Vitalik Buterin, co-founder of Ethereum, proposed integrating zero-knowledge Ethereum Virtual Machines (zk-EVMs) at Ethereum's base layer to expedite the verification process without compromising decentralization and security. zk-EVMs could execute smart contracts through ZK proofs, and the use of multiple clients (consensus, execution, and zk-EVM) would maintain decentralization at the protocol level. However, layer 1-based apps could become economically nonviable, and small funds might get stuck with gas fees escalation. An "open" zk-EVM system would require different clients with compatible implementations, preserving the multi-client paradigm and facilitating new client development. zk-EVMs could simplify the process of running a full Ethereum node, and significant progress has been made with layer-2 scaling platform Polygon's open-sourced zkEVM. Buterin's proposal balances scalability with decentralization and security, and the integration of zk-EVMs could lead to significant advancements in efficiency, accessibility,

title: PancakeSwap Launches version 3 on BNB Chain & Ethereum - CryptoTvplus
summary: PancakeSwap, a leading decentralized exchange on the BNB Chain, has launched Version 3 of its AMM DEX on the Ethereum and BNB Chain network. The updated platform offers improved profits for liquidity providers and lower fees for on-chain trades compared to peers like SushiSwap and Uniswap. Version 3 introduces four trading fee tiers (0.01%, 0.05%, 0.25%, and 1%) and features such as position management and a VIP trading rewards program. These upgrades aim to increase liquidity and revenue for the platform.

title: LayerZero raises $120M to expand cross-chain messaging efforts - Cointelegraph
summary: LayerZero Labs, a cross-chain messaging protocol developer, has raised $120M in funding to expand its efforts in creating a multichain environment. The company has a valuation of $3B and plans to use the funds to increase headcount and enter the Asia-Pacific region. LayerZero's protocol allows for seamless connection between different blockchains, enabling chain-agnostic applications and a best-in-class user experience. The funding round was led by Sequoia Capital, Andreessen Horowitz, and other notable investors. The company's efforts aim to solve the issue of securing cross-chain messages, which has become a major problem in the industry, with over $3B stolen from blockchain bridges in 2022.

title: As MicroStrategy Buys Up BTC Tokens, Which Cryptocurrency Could Be Good Investments? A Look At Bitcoin ... - Analytics Insight
summary: MicroStrategy, a software solution provider, has been buying up Bitcoin (BTC) tokens in large quantities, highlighting institutional investment in cryptocurrency. Bitcoin remains the largest and most widely used cryptocurrency, with a market cap of $549 billion. Ethereum (ETH) is also popular due to its reputation of trust, accessibility, and reliability, particularly in DeFi spaces. A new cryptocurrency, Dogetti (DETI), is gaining attention for its unique approach to investment, embedding members into its ecosystem and giving them a stake in the meme-based cryptocurrency. Dogetti (DETI) is currently in presale and has the potential to be a lucrative investment.

title: Ethereum's Upcoming EIP-4844 Upgrade Has Game-Changing Potential, Says Bitwise CIO - CryptoGlobe
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Bitwise CIO Matt Hougan is optimistic about Ethereum's (ETH) future, particularly the upcoming EIP-4844 upgrade. The upgrade aims to reduce transaction costs, unlocking new applications. Hougan believes that the current state of the crypto market shows increasing investor confidence, and he expects more people to realize this as the year progresses. EIP-4844 is a proposed improvement to enhance Ethereum's scalability, and its implementation is expected in the second half of 2023. The upgrade introduces a new transaction type that accepts "blobs" of data, enabling full danksharding. Hougan also mentioned other innovations in danksharding, such as merged fee markets and proposer/builder separation. He previously appeared on a podcast, highlighting the importance of having both Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH) in one's portfolio, with Bitcoin being the go-to choice for institutions.
